title: Graph of Function - Increasing and Concave Down

content.description:
Moving from left to right:

The curve begins at the point with approximate coordinates (0.8 comma 0), labeled A on the x-axis.

The curve trends up steeply, then continues up gradually, leveling off at a maximum at the point with approximate coordinates (2.8 comma 5.4), labeled B.

At point (2.8 comma 5.4), the curve trends down gradually then more steeply, passes through labeled C with approximate coordinates (4.5 comma 3.4), then gradually levels off to reach a minimum at the point with approximate coordinates (6.2 comma 1.2), labeled D.

At point (6.2 comma 1.2), the curve trends up gradually to the right, then more steeply ending at the point with approximate coordinates (8 comma 5.9), labeled E.

​The figure shows the graph of a function <math alttext="f"> <semantics> <mi>f</mi> <annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation> </semantics> </math>. The zero and extrema for <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> are labeled, and the point of inflection of the graph of <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is labeled. Let <math alttext="A"><semantics><mi>A</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, <math alttext="B"><semantics><mi>B</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, <math alttext="C"><semantics><mi>C</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, <math alttext="D"><semantics><mi>D</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, and <math alttext="E"><semantics><mi>E</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> represent the <math alttext="x"><semantics><mi>x</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-coordinates at those points.
content.question: Of the following, on which interval is <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> increasing and the graph of <math alttext="f"> <semantics> <mi>f</mi> <annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation> </semantics> </math> concave down?

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
